concept.title: Part III: Topic Types
concept.shortdesc: This module introduces core DITA topic types and their appropriate usage to improve content clarity and organization.

conbody.p: DITA defines several structured topic types, each intended for a different documentation purpose. Every DITA document falls into one of the following categories:

Whenever you create a new DITA document, you need to determine which topic type is appropriate for the information you want to convey. Using the correct topic type ensures that your content is well organized and reusable across deliverables.

section.title: Learning Objectives
section.p: Upon completing this module, you will be able to:

ul.li: Explain the purpose and appropriate use cases for the core DITA topic types.
Identify the structural elements (tags) associated with each topic type.
Apply each topic type correctly when structuring your content.
Understand how different topic types work together to form comprehensive documentation.
